comment.author: 77155450@N04
comment._content: Charles Frederick Bilson - born 1889 Hornsey, died 1948 Sunderland. Commissioned 2nd Lt 30.1.1916; awarded MC - see London Gazette 9 Jan 1918

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
The bravery of these men is worthy of acknowledgement in full.  In the case of Lieutenant Charles Frederick Bilson RE it was recognised with the award of a Military Cross on 9th January 1918, the citation for which reads as follows:

T/Lt Charles Frederick Bilson. RE,

For conspicuous gallantry and devotion to duty.  He took charge of a convoy which had failed three times under enemy shelling to get their loads through, and by his personal example and power of command over men who belonged to a unit not his own, succeeded at the fourth attempt in getting the wagons to their destination.  On another occasion he carried out personal and fearless daylight reconnaissances under continuous sniping and machine-gun fire, and sent in accurate and useful reports as to the position of our front line.//
